thread.title: Ground News - SA vs IND 1st Test: Rohit Sharma takes blame for defeat in Centurion, says 'we were not good enough to win'
thread.title_full: Ground News - SA vs IND 1st Test: Rohit Sharma takes blame for defeat in Centurion, says 'we were not good enough to win'

author: WION
title: Ground News - SA vs IND 1st Test: Rohit Sharma takes blame for defeat in Centurion, says 'we were not good enough to win'
text:
Summary by WION India were bowled out for 131 in their second innings and lost the contest on Day 3 as their wait for a series win on the Proteas soil continues. Dean Elgar was the star of the match with his 185-run knock, while Kagiso Rabada scalped seven wickets, including a five-for in the first innings. The win now sees South Africa lead the two-match series 1-0, making it impossible for India to win the series. Share menu More

Dean Elgar was the star of the match with his 185-run knock, while Kagiso Rabada scalped seven wickets, including a five-for in the first innings. The win now sees South Africa lead the two-match series 1-0, making it impossible for India to win the series.

5 hours ago 路 Noida, India Read Full Article India Today Lean Right Mixed Factuality Media Conglomerate: Living Media SA v IND, 1st Test: Centurion defeat doesn't mean India don't know how to bat overseas, says Rohit Sharma South Africa vs India, 1st Test: Speaking to the press after their innings and 32-run defeat in Centurion, Rohit Sharma said it's not fair to rubbish India's batting line-up after one bad performance. The skipper highlighted that a similiar set of batters helped them win series in Australia and draw one in England in the past.
